item.title: 1:12 Scale GPS/Compass Guided RC Car
item.description: A 1:12 scale rc buggy fitted with GPS/compass and proximity sensing hardware allowing for autonomous waypoint navigation

item.title: 3D Printing
item.description: I’ve experimented a lot with 3d printing technologies and have constructed several rather unique machines.

item.title: All in One Drone Control Terminal (Cyberdeck)
item.description: A computer, FPV video system, SDR radio, RC transmitter, and power system enclosed in a weatherprood case

item.title: Bikepacking Adventures
item.description: I’m a bikepacking enthusiast and have gone on many trips exploring the surronding areas. Biking through the natural beauty is always a great experience.

item.title: CAD (Solidworks/Fusion)
item.description: A small tricopter vtol allowing for fun fixed wing FPV out of areas that lack runway space

item.title: Cargo (E)Bike
item.description: My reliable and extremely capable transport for the last few years. With over 400 lbs of carrying capacity and excellent off road handling, it’s a go-anywhere machine.

item.title: High Payload Fixed Wing Testbed
item.description: A high capacity cargo platform capable of lifting test equipment into the air remain on station for extended periods of time.

item.title: Long Endurance Fixed Wing Camera Platform
item.description: A autonomous, long endurance, high altitude camera platform for gimballed fpv Overview I planned out this aircraft to soely focus on efficiency and stable flight performance. With a 5.5Kg max takeoff weight and two 6s 10aH lipo battery, this aircraft can stay in the air for over 3 hours. Swap one of the batteries for a downward facing DSLR camera and the aircraft becomes a capable mapping platform. Control is handled vial the latest H7 processor running ardupilot firmware enabling the aircraft to navigate autonomously, accept waypoint missions, and operate a three axis gimbal installed in the nose.

item.title: Oceangoing Autonomous Catamaran
item.description: A research project in my university lab with the aim to develop highly modular, 3D printable unmanned surface vehicles (USVs) for research and cargo transport

item.title: Solar Ebike
item.description: 350 watts of light weight solar panels on a custom frame fixed to a trailer providing a significant boost to ebike range and allowing remote drone flying

item.title: Subnautica Spy Pengling
item.description: This is 1:1 functional replica of the spy pengling robot from the game Subnautica - Below Zero.

item.title: Subnautica Survival Knife
item.description: This is 1:1 replica of the iconic survival knife from the game subnautica. Overview This was my first attempt at selling a product as well as my first project into blade smithing and low volume mass production. Subnautica is one of my favorite games for its unique story and its great artworks. Given that I had access to a very capable machine shop, I wanted to create the most accurate replica of the iconic survival knife.

item.title: TIG/MIG Welding
item.description: A high capacity cargo platform capable of lifting test equipment into the air remain on station for extended periods of time.

item.title: Tricopter VTOL
item.description: A small tricopter vtol allowing for fun fixed wing FPV out of areas that lack runway space

item.title: Yonder Dynamics
item.description: As a member and lead of electrical team, Yonder Dynamics was one of the most fun experiences I’ve had and taught me so much about engineering

Some info about myself. My name is Robin Wang and I am currently a 3rd year computer engineering major at University of California, San Diego. Aside from the regular university classes, I am an avid robotics enthusiast and have built several projects related to the topic.
